intro: Tounatea benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthams' tounatea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and for horticultural purposes.
